item.title: 斯坦查特为巴哈马完成 3 亿美元债务转换交易
item.description: 渣打银行（Standard Chartered Plc）完成了一笔 3 亿美元的交易，这笔交易将使巴哈马能够进行债务再融资，并将节省下来的资金用于海洋保护。【原文：Standard Chartered Plc has wrapped up a $300 million deal that will allow the Bahamas to refinance debt and allocate savings to ocean conservation.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦出人意料的太阳能热潮
item.description: 早上好，我来自巴库。COP29的谈判代表们仍在努力解决如何为发展中国家提供更多国际气候融资的深刻分歧。周四的一项初步提案引发了广泛的愤怒，我们现在正处于等待协议更新的胶着状态。您可以在彭博网站（Bloomberg.com）了解最新消息以及我们对 COP29 的所有报道— 免费— 。【原文：Good morning from Baku. Negotiators at COP29 are still trying to resolve deep differences over how to scale up international climate finance for developing nations. An initial proposal on Thursday sparked widespread anger, and we’re now in a holding pattern as we wait for updates on a deal. You can catch up with the latest news and all of our COP29 coverage — for free — at Bloomberg.com.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦太阳能蓬勃发展，为数百万人带来惊喜，却对电网造成危害
item.description: 巴基斯坦尘土飞扬的农业中心地带新添了一个闪亮的亮点：一排排太阳能电池板。【原文：There’s a shiny new addition to Pakistan’s dusty agricultural heartland: rows upon rows of solar panels.】

item.title: 汤姆-斯太尔的房地产部门投资新泽西州房产
item.description: 亿万富翁汤姆-斯泰尔（Tom Steyer）的 Galvanize Climate Solutions LLC 公司的房地产部门在短短半年多的时间里进行了第三次收购，购买了新泽西州的一处房产，以建立一个以去碳化为目标的资产组合。【原文：The real estate division of billionaire Tom Steyer’s Galvanize Climate Solutions LLC has made its third acquisition in just over six months, purchasing a New Jersey property as it builds a portfolio of assets targeted for decarbonization.】

item.title: 沙特阿美首席财务官在气候抗议活动后离开波士顿附近的活动现场
item.description: 气候抗议者扰乱了麻省理工学院与沙特阿拉伯石油公司（Saudi Arabian Oil Co.首席财务官齐亚德-穆尔希德（Ziad Al-Murshed）周四在波士顿郊区举行的活动，导致这位高管离开。【原文：Climate protesters disrupted an MIT event with Saudi Arabian Oil Co. Chief Financial Officer Ziad Al-Murshed in a Boston suburb on Thursday, causing the executive to leave.】

item.title: 克里称世界将 "无法实现 "1.5℃的气候目标
item.description: 前美国气候特使约翰-克里（John Kerry）说，世界将超过把升温幅度限制在比工业化前水平高出 1.5 摄氏度的目标，这让人怀疑甚至 "扳回 "这一目标是否可能。【原文：Former US climate envoy John Kerry said the world is set to blow past a goal of limiting warming to 1.5C above pre-industrial levels, raising doubts about whether even “clawing back” to that target is possible.】

item.title: COP29: 一项失败的协议可能导致上届缔约方大会失败
item.description: 晚上好，来自巴库。有些人认为，如果大家都不满意，那通常是妥协成功的标志。这在这里肯定不适用。在阿塞拜疆，我们还远远没有达成最终协议，各国在资金和减排问题上存在分歧。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上免费收看我们对 COP29 的所有报道。【原文：Good evening from Baku. There are some people who believe that if no one is happy, it’s usually a sign of a good compromise. That certainly doesn’t apply here. We’re still far from a final deal in Azerbaijan with nations divided on money and mitigation. You can catch up with all of our COP29 coverage — which is free — on Bloomberg.com.】

item.title: 致命炸弹旋风切断了西雅图和温哥华郊区的电力供应
item.description: 一场猛烈的炸弹气旋已造成至少两人死亡，引发洪水暴雨，并导致太平洋西北部和加拿大部分地区停电，其中包括西雅图和温哥华郊区。【原文：A ferocious bomb cyclone has killed at least two people, triggered flooding rains and knocked out power to parts of the Pacific Northwest and Canada, including Seattle and the suburbs of Vancouver.】

item.title: 认识世界上最具争议的气候资本家
item.description:
在 COP29 会议上，谈判代表们正努力为能源转型下定义或提供资金时，埃克森公司首席执行官达伦-伍兹（Darren Woods）发表了自己的观点。附带注释的采访。【原文：

As negotiators at COP29 struggle to define or finance the energy transition, Exxon CEO Darren Woods turned up with a pitch of his own. An annotated interview.

】

item.title: COP29 谈判陷入僵局。巴西已开始关注 COP30
item.description:
巴西气候、能源和环境部长安德烈-科雷亚-多拉戈（André Corrêa do Lago）在本周的《零点》节目中说："我们并不想掩盖我们所面临的问题。【原文：

“We are not trying to hide the problems we have,” André Corrêa do Lago, Brazil’s Secretary for Climate, Energy and the Environment, says on this week’s episode of Zero.  

】

item.title: 纽约市与火灾和恐惧作斗争，两周内发生 271 起火灾，震撼全城
item.description:
难以到达的地方野火频发，消防员疲于奔命，细雨难解燃眉之急

Drizzle provides little relief as wildfires in difficult-to-reach locales exhaust firefighters

】

item.title: 英国家庭不用电将获得报酬
item.description: 英国电网运营商将于下周推出一项服务，允许家庭和企业在电网紧张时减少用电量，从而获得报酬。【原文：The UK’s grid operator will launch a service next week that will allow homes and businesses to get paid for using less power during times when the grid is strained.】

item.title: 埃克森承诺出资 2 亿美元扩大得克萨斯州的先进回收利用规模
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司（Exxon Mobil Corp. ）宣布，计划将其在得克萨斯州的所谓先进塑料回收能力提高两倍以上，此举是对加州官员提出的诉讼的回击。【原文：Exxon Mobil Corp. announced plans to more than triple its so-called advanced-plastics recycling capacity in Texas in a move that pushes back against a lawsuit by California officials.】

item.title: 阿联酋价值 300 亿美元的能源转型基金资金周转困难
item.description: 阿拉伯联合酋长国一年前发起的一个具有里程碑意义的基金，在努力寻找适合其能源转型投资任务的交易时，仅花费了一小部分现金。【原文：A landmark fund launched by the United Arab Emirates a year ago has managed to spend just a small fraction of its cash, as it struggles to find deals suited to its mandate of investing in the energy transition.】

item.title: 特斯拉在为其他电动汽车提供充电器方面进展缓慢
item.description:
电动汽车市场的领导者将从共享超级充电站中获得收益，但到目前为止，该公司在美国的 2500 个超级充电站中只有约 100 个为其他汽车品牌进行了改装。【原文：

The EV market leader will get a revenue jolt from sharing its Superchargers, but so far only about 100 of the company’s 2,500 US Supercharger stations are retrofitted for other car brands.

】

item.title: 人工智能基金为气候和能源领域融资 2 亿美元
item.description: 2024 年 10 月 23 日星期三，英国 Faversham 附近 Cleve Hill 太阳能公园的太阳能电池板。Mytilineos 承担了该太阳能园的工程设计、采购和建设工作，每年将生产 373.922 千兆瓦时的可再生能源电力，足以满足 10 万多户英国家庭的需求。【原文：Solar panels at Cleve Hill Solar Park near Faversham, UK, on Wednesday, Oct. 23, 2024. Mytilineos has undertaken the engineering, procurement and construction of this solar park, that will produce 373.922 GWh of renewable electricity per year, enough to meet the needs of over 100,000 UK homes.】

item.title: 印尼总统普拉博沃誓言在 15 年内淘汰所有煤电厂
item.description: 印度尼西亚总统普拉博沃-苏比安托（Prabowo Subianto）表示，政府计划在 15 年内退役全国所有的煤电厂，以帮助阻止全球变暖。【原文：Indonesia President Prabowo Subianto said the government plans to retire all the nation’s coal power plants within 15 years to help stem global warming.】

item.title: 免受勒索，奥地利称俄罗斯天然气工业股份公司的合同取决于 OMV
item.description: 奥地利最高能源官员表示，OMV AG 的高管和股东可以决定是否让这家部分国有的公司从长期的俄罗斯天然气合同中解脱出来。【原文：Austria’s top energy official said it’s the decision of OMV AG executives and shareholders whether or not to extricate the partially state-owned company from its long-term Russian natural gas contract.】

item.title: 暴风雪席卷北欧，大雪覆盖北欧
item.description: 北极的冰冻天气正在考验欧洲的运输和电力系统，而一场暴风雪正在袭击北欧地区。【原文：Freezing Arctic weather is testing Europe’s transport and power systems, while a blizzard is hitting the Nordic region.】

item.title: 起诉阿达尼玷污了印度向世界展示的绿色形象
item.description: 印度大亨高塔姆-阿达尼（Gautam Adani）努力将自己重新定义为清洁能源倡导者，并为对印度能源转型至关重要的项目争取海外融资，但美国的起诉威胁到了他的努力。【原文：A US indictment threatens Indian tycoon Gautam Adani’s efforts to redefine himself as a clean-power champion and secure overseas financing for projects vital to the nation’s energy transition.】

item.title: 墨西哥承诺实现气候净零排放，向其他国家发出倡议
item.description: 墨西哥正努力在 2050 年前实现零净经济，这标志着该国在一位将气候变化问题列为优先事项的新总统的领导下，为更积极地应对气候变化做出了新的努力。【原文：Mexico is working to have a net zero economy by 2050, marking a fresh bid by the country to more aggressively confront climate change under a new president that has prioritized the issue.】

item.title: COP29 峰会将数万亿美元气候融资问题摆上桌面
item.description: COP29 联合国气候峰会周四发布了第一份协议草案，其中提出至少提供 1 万亿美元的资金，但资金来源的关键细节仍有待敲定。【原文：The COP29 UN climate summit released a first draft deal Thursday which puts at least $1 trillion of financing on the table, yet key details on where that money will come from still need to be ironed out.】

item.title: 海洋在缔约方大会上被忽视
item.description: 早上好，来自巴库。COP29今天的主题之一是海洋，这已经引起了海洋活动家们的关注，他们可能会问，为什么世界上最大的碳汇要和其他主题共用一天的时间。请继续阅读，并在彭博社网站上了解有关 COP29 协议进展的所有最新消息，该网站对峰会的所有报道都是免费的。【原文：Good morning from Baku. One of the themes today at COP29 is the ocean, which is already needling to marine activists who may wonder why the world’s largest carbon sink has to share a day with other topics. Read on for more, and catch up with all of the latest news on the COP29 deal progress at Bloomberg.com, where all coverage of the summit is free.】

item.title: 德里官员的争吵让数百万人窒息在有毒空气中
item.description: 本周，当多年来最严重的空气污染降临印度首都时，印度卫生部长并没有在新德里协调应对措施。相反，他正在 800 英里之外的一个邦进行竞选活动。【原文：As the worst air pollution in years descended on India’s capital this week, the country’s health minister was not in New Delhi coordinating a response. Instead, he was 800 miles away, campaigning in a state election.】

item.title: 为将海洋作为气候优先事项，倡导者将目光投向 COP29 之外
item.description:
海洋问题在联合国会议上很少受到关注，因此海洋活动家正致力于将相关措施纳入各国的官方绿色目标。【原文：

Marine issues are receiving little attention at the United Nations conference, so ocean activists are aiming to include measures in countries’ official green targets.

】

item.title: 冰岛西南角火山再次爆发
item.description: 冰岛在不到一年的时间里迎来了第七次火山爆发，熔岩再次从西南部一个遭受重创的渔镇附近的地面喷涌而出。【原文：Iceland is facing its seventh volcanic eruption in less than a year as lava is again gushing from the ground near a devastated southwestern fishing town.】

item.title: 英国让家庭更容易安装电热泵
item.description: 英国正在加大对电热泵的支持力度，这是一项关键技术，可减少该国冬季家庭取暖对天然气的依赖。【原文：The UK is ramping up support for electric heat pumps, a key technology to cut the country’s dependence on natural gas to keep homes warm during winter.】

item.title: 菲律宾农作物绝收，风暴拦河坝威胁菲律宾经济增长
item.description: 雨季后期的六场强风暴肆虐农作物，菲律宾大片地区被淋成了落汤鸡，导致该国大米进口量创下历史新高，并引发了对粮食通胀上升的担忧。【原文：Six powerful storms late in the season that ravaged crops and drenched vast areas of the Philippines have put the nation on track for record rice imports and raised concerns over elevated food inflation.】

item.title: 汇丰银行搁置碳信用额交易和融资计划
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，汇丰控股公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）已放弃设立碳信用额柜台的计划，因为这家欧洲最大的银行因屡次被指控 "洗绿 "而对市场感到冷静。【原文：HSBC Holdings Plc has abandoned plans to build a carbon credits desk, according to people familiar with the matter, as Europe’s biggest bank cools to a market rocked by repeated allegations of greenwashing.】

item.title: Liquid Wind 从 Uniper 和三星获得 4600 万美元，用于生产清洁燃料
item.description: 瑞典的 Liquid Wind AB 公司从 Uniper SE 和 Samsung Ventures 等公司筹集了 4400 万欧元（4600 万美元），用于其为航运业生产绿色燃料的计划。【原文：Sweden’s Liquid Wind AB raised €44 million ($46 million) from firms including Uniper SE and Samsung Ventures for its plan to produce green fuel for the shipping industry.】
